details.headline: Type
Static method
details.description: The value is in percentage ranging between 0 and 1.

details.summary: Whether the device is being charged.

details.summary: Whether the device is being not plugged into power and thus discharging.

details.headline: Static method
details.summary: Whether the device is lying parallel to the ground with the screen facing downwards.

details.headline: Static method
details.summary: Whether the device is lying parallel to the ground with the screen facing upwards.

details.headline: Static method
details.summary: Whether the device is fully charged.

details.headline: Static method
details.summary: Whether the device is in landscape with the home button or home indicator on the left side.

details.headline: Static method
details.summary: Whether the device is in portrait with the home button or home indicator at the bottom.

details.headline: Static method
details.summary: Whether the device is in portrait but upside down with the home button or home indicator at the top.

details.headline: Static method
details.summary: Whether the device is a pad.
details.description:
You can use this property to choose behavior of a script depending on
whether its running on a phone or a pad.

details.headline: Static method
details.summary: Whether the device is a phone.
details.description:
You can use this property to choose behavior of a script depending on
whether its running on a phone or a pad.

details.headline: Static method
details.summary: Whether the device is using dark appearance.
details.description: This API is not supported in widgets.

details.headline: Static method
details.description: You can find and edit the name of your device in the system settings.

details.headline: Static method
details.description: The list is ordered according to the language preferences specified in the system settings.

details.headline: Static method
details.summary: Brightness of the screen in percentage.
details.description: The value range from 0 to 1. To set the screen brightness, refer to the setScreenBrightness() function.

details.headline: Static method
details.description: The value is measured in pixels. The value does not take the rotation of the deviec into account.

details.headline: Static method
details.description: Standard resolution displays have a scale of 1.0 where one point on the screen equals one pixel. Retina displays will have a scale factor of 2.0 or 3.0 where one point on the screen is four or nine pixels, respectively.

details.headline: Static method
details.description: The value is measured in points. For an explanation of the relationship between points and pixels, see the documentation of the screenScale() method. The value takes the device rotation into account, so the value will vary between portrait and landscape.

details.headline: Static method
details.summary: Sets the brightness of the screen.
details.description: The value range from 0 to 1. To get the screen brightness, refer to the screenBrightness() function.

infos.title: percentage
infos.subtitle: number
infos.description: Percentage to set the screen brightness to. Value between 0 and 1.

details.headline: Static method
details.description: The value range from 0 to 1.
Reads information about the current device and its screen.

details.headline: Type
Static method
details.description:
Presents an interface that shows the dictated string. Press "Done"
when you are done dictating the text.

infos.title: locale
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Optional string identifier that specifies the language to dictate in. E.g. "en" for English, "it" for Italian and "da" for Danish. Defaults to the locale of the device.

infos.subtitle: Promise<string>
infos.description: Promise that provides the dictated text when fulfilled.

details.description: Presents an interface that lets you dictate a text. You can specify the locale of the text you want to dictate when calling the start() function. Dictation must manually be stopped from the presented interface when you are finished dictating.

details.headline: Type
Static method
details.summary: Exports a file to a document.
details.description: Exports the file to a document with. A picker prompting for a destination to export the document to is presented.

infos.title: path
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Path of the file to export.

infos.subtitle: Promise<[string]>
infos.description: Promise that provides paths for the selected file destination when fulfilled.

details.headline: Static method
details.decleration: static exportData(data: Data, name: string): Promise<[string]>
details.description: Exports data to a new file. The name of the file can optionally be specified. A picker prompting for a destination to export the document to is presented.

infos.title: data
infos.subtitle: Data
infos.description: Data to export.

infos.title: name
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Optional name of the image to export.

infos.subtitle: Promise<[string]>
infos.description: Promise that provides the path of the selected destination when fulfilled.

details.headline: Static method
details.decleration: static exportImage(image: Image, name: string): Promise<[string]>
details.description: Exports an image to a new file. The name of the file can optionally be specified. A picker prompting for a destination to export the document to is presented.

infos.title: image
infos.subtitle: Image
infos.description: Image to export.

infos.title: name
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Optional name of the image to export.

infos.subtitle: Promise<[string]>
infos.description: Promise that provides the path of the selected destination when fulfilled.

details.headline: Static method
details.decleration: static exportString(content: string, name: string): Promise<[string]>
details.summary: Exports a string to a document.
details.description: Exports a string to a new file. The name of the file can optionally be specified. A picker prompting for a destination to export the document to is presented.

infos.title: content
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Content of the document to export.

infos.title: name
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Optional name of the document to export.

infos.subtitle: Promise<[string]>
infos.description: Promise that provides the path of the selected destination when fulfilled.

details.headline: Static method
details.description: Presents a document picker for opening a document from the Files app. It is up to the user to specify which types of files can be opened. Types are specified as UTIs, e.g. "public.plain-text" or "public.image". If you want to open a file of any file type, see the openFile function and if you want to open a folder, see the openFolder function. When fulfilled the returned promise will provide the paths for the selected documents. Use an instance of FileManager to read the contents of the files.

infos.title: types
infos.subtitle: [string]
infos.description: Types of files to select. Specified using UTIs. Defaults to all files.

infos.subtitle: Promise<[string]>
infos.description: Promise that provides paths for the selected documents when fulfilled.

details.headline: Static method
details.summary: Opens a file of any file type.
details.description:
Presents a document picker for opening a file from the Files app. The document picker will allow the selection of any file.

When fulfilled the returned promise will provide the paths for the selected files.

infos.subtitle: Promise<string>
infos.description: Promise that provides paths for the selected files when fulfilled.

details.headline: Static method
details.description:
Presents a document picker for opening a folder from the Files app.

When fulfilled the returned promise will provide the paths for the selected files.

infos.subtitle: Promise<string>
infos.description: Promise that provides paths for the selected folders when fulfilled.

details.description:
Use this to present a picker that allows opening a document from Files app or exporting a document to Files app.
When opening a document, the picker will prompt you to select one or more documents after which you will get the path for the documents. Use the FileManager to read the content of these files.
When exporting a document, the picker will ask you to select a destination to store the document.

details.headline: Type
Instance property
details.subtitle: bool
details.summary: Determines whether the context is opaque.
details.description: When enabled your image will be rendered opaque. Default is true.

details.headline: Instance property
details.subtitle: bool
details.summary: Enable to respect the scale of the screen.
details.description:
Devices have a screen scale that is used to convert between the logical coordinate space and the device coordinate space. For example, retina screens have a screen scale of 2 or 3 meaning that one point in the logical coordinate space is represented by four or nine pixels. Respecting the screen scale will multiply the specified size of the canvas by the screen scale. For example a canvas of size 200 by 200 will be 600 by 600 when the image is rendered on a retina screen with a screen scale of 3.
When respecting the screen scale is disabled, you may experience that your images looks blurry because essentially the size you have specified will be stretched when rendered on the screen. Default is false.

details.headline: Instance property
details.subtitle: Size
details.description:
Specifies the size of the canvas on which you are drawing. The image returned by getImage() will have this exact size,
except if respectScreenScale is true.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Constructs a canvas to draw on.
details.description: Constructs a new canvas to draw images, shapes and texts on.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Adds a path to the context.
details.description: After adding a path to the context, the path can be stroked or filled by calling strokePath and fillPath. Note that only the path that was added latest will be affected by calls to strokePath and fillPath.

infos.title: path
infos.subtitle: Path
infos.description: Path to add to the context.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Draws an image at the specified point.
details.description: Draws the image at the point. The top-left corner of the image will be drawn at the specified point.

infos.title: image
infos.subtitle: Image
infos.description: Image to draw.

infos.title: point
infos.subtitle: Point
infos.description: Point at which to draw top-left corner of the image.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Draws an image in the specified rect.
details.description: Draws the image in the rectangle. The image will be scaled to fit within the rectangle.

infos.title: image
infos.subtitle: Image
infos.description: Image to draw.

infos.title: rect
infos.subtitle: Rect
infos.description: Rectangle to draw the image in.

details.headline: Instance method
details.description: Call this to draw a text string to the context. The top-left of the text will be drawn at the specified position.

infos.title: text
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Text to draw.

infos.title: pos
infos.subtitle: Point
infos.description: Position to draw the top-left of the text.

details.headline: Instance method
details.description: Call this to draw a text string in a rectangle. Specify how the text should be aligned within the rectangle by calling setTextAlignedLeft, setTextAlignedCenter or setTextAlignedRight before drawing the text.

infos.title: text
infos.subtitle: string
infos.description: Text to draw.

infos.title: rect
infos.subtitle: Rect
infos.description: Rectangle to draw text in.

details.headline: Instance method
details.description: Fills the rectangle with the color set when calling setFillColor.

infos.title: rect
infos.subtitle: Rect
infos.description: Rectangle to fill.

details.headline: Instance method
details.description: Fills the ellipse that fits within the supplied rectangle with the color set when calling setFillColor.

infos.title: rect
infos.subtitle: Rect
infos.description: Rectangle incapsulating the ellipse to fill.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Fills the path that was added the latest.
details.description: The path that was latest added to the context is filled with the color set using setFillColor.

details.headline: Instance method
details.description: Fills the rectangle with the color set when calling setFillColor.

infos.title: rect
infos.subtitle: Rect
infos.description: Rectangle to fill.

details.headline: Instance method
details.description: Call this to retrieve the image you have drawn to the context. Note that this should be called before calling endDrawing().

infos.subtitle: Image
infos.description: The image drawn to the context.

details.headline: Instance method
details.description: Sets the fill color to be used when performing a fill operation. Any fill operation performed afterwards will fill with the specified color until another call to setFillColor is made.

infos.title: color
infos.subtitle: Color
infos.description: Color to set for filling.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Sets the font to use when drawing text.
details.description: Sets the font to be used when drawing texts to the context.

infos.title: font
infos.subtitle: Font
infos.description: Font to use when drawing text.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Sets the font size used when drawing text.
details.description: Sets the font size to be used when drawing texts to the context.

infos.title: size
infos.subtitle: number
infos.description: Font size to use when drawing text.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Sets the line width for stroking.
details.description: Sets the line width to be used when performing a stroke operation.

infos.title: width
infos.subtitle: number
infos.description: Line width to use for stroking.

details.headline: Instance method
details.description: Sets the stroke color to be used when performing a stroke operation. Any stroke operation performed afterwards will stroke with the specified color until another call to setStrokeColor is made.

infos.title: color
infos.subtitle: Color
infos.description: Color to set for stroking.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Specifies that texts should be center aligned.
details.description: Sets text alignment to center. Texts drawn after calling this will be center aligned inside the provided rectangle.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Specifies that texts should be left aligned.
details.description: Sets text alignment to left. Texts drawn after calling this will be left aligned inside the provided rectangle.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Specifies that texts should be right aligned.
details.description: Sets text alignment to right. Texts drawn after calling this will be right aligned inside the provided rectangle.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Sets the text color used when drawing text.
details.description: Sets the text color to be used when drawing text strings to the context.

infos.title: color
infos.subtitle: Color
infos.description: Color to use when drawing text.

details.headline: Instance method
details.description: Draws a line around the rectangle using the color set when calling setStrokeColor. The line will have the width set when calling setLineWidth.

infos.title: rect
infos.subtitle: Rect
infos.description: Rectangle to stroke.

details.headline: Instance method
details.description: Draws a line around the ellipse that fits within the supplied rectangle. The line will have the color set when calling setStrokeColor and the width set when calling setLineWidth.

infos.title: rect
infos.subtitle: Rect
infos.description: Rectangle incapsulating the ellipse to stroke.

details.headline: Instance method
details.summary: Strokes the path that was added the latest.
details.description: The path that was added the latest to the context is stroked with the color set using setStrokeColor and the line width set using setLineWidth.

details.headline: Instance method
details.description: Draws a line around the rectangle using the color set when calling setStrokeColor. The line will have the width set when calling setLineWidth.

infos.title: rect
infos.subtitle: Rect
infos.description: Rectangle to stroke.

details.description: An instance of DrawContext is a canvas on which you can draw an image using shapes, texts and other images. You must specify the size of your canvas by setting the size property. At any point after beginning your drawing and before ending your drawing can you call getImage() to get an image object of your drawing. When you are done drawing your image, you should call endDrawing().
